alert.note: Alert for San Francisco (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 5:43PM PST until December 25 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM PST MONDAY THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 11 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, breaking waves 10 to 12 feet expected. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...San Francisco County. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, from 1 AM PST Monday through Monday evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 AM to 11 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. For the Beach Hazards Statement expect dangerous water conditions including localized beach erosion. Large waves can sweep across the beach without warning, pulling people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tidal levels are running around 1 foot higher than tidal predictions. High tide will peak about 9:26 am PST Monday between 7.0 to 7.5 feet, resulting in minor coastal flooding for low-lying, flood-prone spots adjacent to the San Francisco Bay. For the Beach Hazards Statement mainly northwest facing beaches are most at risk for large, turbulent shore break and strong currents. Northwest waves will gradually subside later in the day on Christmas.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
